docs.snippet: MOORE--A. Preston, 87, June 22nd, 2007, in Atlanta. Born in Washington, D.C., August 7, 1919. Preston attended Dartmouth College 1943. He served as LT. Officer in the Pacific on USS Dale during WWII. After the war he received a Master Architectural...
docs.lead_paragraph: MOORE--A. Preston, 87, June 22nd, 2007, in Atlanta. Born in Washington, D.C., August 7, 1919. Preston attended Dartmouth College 1943. He served as LT. Officer in the Pacific on USS Dale during WWII. After the war he received a Master Architectural Decree at Harvard Grad School, 1949. He married Clair Hague in 1951 in NYC. During his distinguished architecture career he worked with Geo Ponti in Italy and with I. M. Pei as associate partner until retirement. He was directly involved in major projects including: US Embassy in Uruguay, apartment buildings in NYC, Boston, Kuwait and Tehran. Other projects included the IBM Armonk Pavilion, Portland Museum, and the Fragrant Hills Hotel in Beijing. He received the Bard Award in 1968 Architectural Consulting for Paley Park, NYC. He lived most of his life in NYC. He enjoyed summers in Wellfleet, Cape Cod, where he was former president and commodore of the Chequessett Yacht and Country Club. He is survived by his son, Matteo Moore in Atlanta, GA, his daughter, Wendy Hale in Duxbury, MA and his twin brother J. Clark Moore in Cashiers, NC. A memorial service to celebrate his life is planned in Wellfleet on September 22.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States will play Brazil on Sept. 9 in Chicago, the United States Soccer federation announced. The match is being billed as a "Clash of Champions," after the Americans won the Concacaf Gold Cup this summer and Brazil, the five-time world champion, brought home the Copa America from Venezuela.

docs.snippet: Pablo Prigioni had 20 points and Luis Scola added 16 yesterday to help Argentina, the defending Olympic champion, defeat Uruguay, 90-69, in its opener in the FIBA Americas tournament in Las Vegas. Uruguay center Esteban Batista was held to 7 points,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Pablo Prigioni had 20 points and Luis Scola added 16 yesterday to help Argentina, the defending Olympic champion, defeat Uruguay, 90-69, in its opener in the FIBA Americas tournament in Las Vegas. Uruguay center Esteban Batista was held to 7 points, shooting 3 for 10. Emilio Taboada led Uruguay (1-1) with 14 points.Carlos Arroyo had 16 points and 8 assists for Puerto Rico in a 108-67 victory over Panama. Ricardo Sanchez scored 19 points and Carmelo Lee had 17 for Puerto Rico (1-1). Gary Forbes scored 19 points for Panama (0-2).Samuel Dalembert scored 6 of his 18 points in the final minutes and Jermaine Anderson scored the last 6 points to finish with 17 in Canada’s 80-73 victory against Venezuela (0-2).

docs.snippet: LeBron James scored 21 points and Kobe Bryant added 20 as the United States clinched the top spot in its group by beating Brazil, 113-76, last night in the FIBA Americas tournament in Las Vegas.Carmelo Anthony had 21 for the Americans (4-0), who for...
docs.lead_paragraph: LeBron James scored 21 points and Kobe Bryant added 20 as the United States clinched the top spot in its group by beating Brazil, 113-76, last night in the FIBA Americas tournament in Las Vegas.Carmelo Anthony had 21 for the Americans (4-0), who for the second straight game pulled away by holding their opponent without a field goal for more than six minutes in the second quarter.Bryant led a defensive effort that held Leandro Barbosa, who entered averaging a tournament-best 27 points, to 4 points.Also yesterday, Greivis Vásquez and Héctor Romero nearly had triple-doubles as Venezuela defeated the United States Virgin Islands, 100-90. Venezuela (1-3) advanced to the second round of the competition. Virgin Islands dropped to 0-4.Uruguay advanced after a 91-82 victory over Mexico.
docs.abstract: US defeats Brazil, 113-76, in FIBA Americas basketball tournament (S)

docs.snippet: Leandro Barbosa, the leading scorer in the FIBA Americas tournament, scored 21 points last night to lead Brazil to a 104-90 victory over Mexico in the second round in Las Vegas.Barbosa, the N.B.A.’s Sixth Man of the Year with the Phoenix Suns last...
docs.lead_paragraph: Leandro Barbosa, the leading scorer in the FIBA Americas tournament, scored 21 points last night to lead Brazil to a 104-90 victory over Mexico in the second round in Las Vegas.Barbosa, the N.B.A.’s Sixth Man of the Year with the Phoenix Suns last season, was 8 for 13 from the field. He fell just short of his tournament average of 23.8 points.Also yesterday, Argentina defeated Canada, 85-70, and Venezuela beat Uruguay, 88-79.The United States, which earned a 127-100 victory against Mexico on Monday night, played Puerto Rico late last night.

docs.snippet: Three years after its stunning loss in the Olympics, the United States smothered Puerto Rico in a 117-78 victory in the FIBA Americas tournament.
